content: memory blanket making a modular mitred square blanket a knitting pattern by georgie nicolson this is by no means an original idea nor do i claim it to be this is however my approach to knitting a mitred square blanket seamlessly and modular for those who detest seaming a thousand little squares together i hope this approach to mitred squares will be of use and open up the world of blanket making i ve knit my blanket with all the left-overs from mostly kids knits for me it provides a memory blanket of all the things i ve knit for my kids a visual capture of where they ve been at that time in their lives the places we ve explored the emotions we ve felt and the experiences we ve shared a record of our journey through life together captured in yarn it s bold and bright which is just the way i like my colours and kids while my sample is knit in dk/8ply weight yarn it is incredibly easy to adjust for other yarn weights skill level easy 2 | memory blanket the how-to abbreviations k2tog knit two stitches together square one lh left hand pink square in bottom right hand corner rh right hand using a us6/4mm needle cast on 40 sts rs right side slipsm slip_stitch marker sm stitch marker row 1 ws knit placing a stitch marker at the halfway point ssk slip slip knit 20 sts in slip two stitches knit-wise one at a time use left needle to knit through both row 2 rs knit to 2 sts before the sm k2tog slipsm ssk st/s stitch/es knit to end of row repeat row 1 and 2 until 2 sts remain repeat row 1 once more size cast off any size the choice is yours make it doll pram cot single queen or even king size square two individual squares measure approximately 3¾ /9 5cm green square above pink square squared cast on 20 stitches place sm yarn holding the first square as a diamond with the cast on edge at the bottom and rs facing pick up and knit 20 sts along the dk/8ply weight yarn -
